children.title: Reporting of carbon emission activity data

ratio.description: The percentage of electricity consumption. Valid values: 0 to 1.

ConstituteItem.description: The item of comstitute analysis list.

ratio.description: Ratio.example value: 0.5 (i. e. 50%).

type.description: A unique key that identifies the gas type.

extInfo.description: The coordinates of the text are in list format.

alignment.description: Enumeration values for page alignment options: center, left, and right.

index.description: The index of the layout in the text.

pageNum.description: Page numbers of the layout, which may include multiple page numbers.

pos.description: Position information of the layout, in list format.

subType.description: Enumeration values for the layout subtypes: picture, para, none

type.description: Enumeration values for the layout types: table, figure, text, and none.

inventoryValuePerProduct.description: Activity data per functional unit: only the third level is not empty; the value retains 24 decimal places, indicating the number of activities per functional unit; should be used in conjunction with the inventoryValuePerProductUnit.

factorDataset.description: The database to which the factorDataset factor belongs. This field is used in conjunction with factorType. If factorType is 1, the data name of the factor is displayed. If factorType is 2,factorId indicates the ID of the referenced product. If factorType is null,factorId is meaningless. This field is a new field. Old data may not have data in this field and is displayed as "/".

percent.description: The percentage. Four decimal places are retained and 31.4000 is returned to indicate the percentage 31.4%. The first level returns null; The second level returns the current process as a percentage of total emissions; the third level returns the current inventory as a percentage of total emissions.

inventoryValuePerProductUnit.description: Unit of activity data per functional unit. Only the third level is not empty. in the inventory information indicates the unit of activity data per functional unit.

num.description: Category key, please refer to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

quantity.description: Raw activity data. Only the third level returns a quantity that is not null, indicating a manifest.

resourceType.description: The type of the inventory. Only the third level returns non-null, and the third level is the inventory details. This field indicates the resource type name of the inventory. You may refer to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

factorType.description: The key of the factor type. Only the third level is not empty. The factorType in the inventory information indicates that the factor source type is selected; the optional values are 1, 2, or null:1: factor library, 2: product library. null indicates that the factor is not selected from the factor library or product library, and the factor is constructed by the user.

unit.description: The unit of environmental impact result value. This unit is the unit of the environmental impact result value of the corresponding environmental impact category. For example, the unit kg CO2-Eq represent the emission values shown here is kg CO2-Eq.

name.description: Returns the name of the current level. The names of different levels have different meanings. The first level returns the environmental impact type. The second level returns the current process name. The third level returns the current inventory name

inventoryValue.description: The quantity of the inventory. It is not empty only at the third level. The third level is the inventory details. This field indicates the id of the inventory. It should be used in conjunction with the InventoryUnit.

state.description: The data status. 1 indicates accurate calculation, 2 indicates default data, 3 indicates missing factor, and 0 value is used in other cases.

factor.description: The value of the factor. Only the third level is not empty. The factor in the inventory information indicates the factor value of the selected factor. The factor value is kept to four decimal places after the decimal point, and "1.0000" indicates that the factor value is 1. The factor value should be used in combination with factorUnit. If factorUnit is "kg CO2-Eq mg/kg", it means that the carbon emission per 1kg of the list is 1kg CO2-Eq.

carbonEmission.description: Emissions are presented with 24 decimal places. It's advisable to utilize the truncated version. These emissions encompass all tiers: At the first level, they reflect the product's total emissions under the current environmental impact; at the second level, they show the process's total emissions; and at the third level, they represent the inventory's emissions within the same environmental impact context.

items.description: The list of children. The third level returns null.

percent.description: Percentage of emissions, for example 100.00 means 100.00%.

byResourceType.description: Grouped by inventory resource type, this data reveals emissions details for each category. It serves the "By type" analysis in the composition breakdown. A nested structure is employed: total carbon emissions are organized first by inventory type, forming a two-level hierarchy, with the innermost level 'byResource' currently empty.

items.description: Aggregates the inventory list by resource type.

Organized hierarchically, it cascades from high to low: flow-> process-> inventory level. Employed for "By inventory" analysis in compositional breakdowns, the innermost layer of this nested structure is empty.

GwpResourceConstitute.description: Carbon emission structure of gwp inventory.

name.description: Name signifies a concept with distinct layers of meaning, where the outermost layer represents the overall carbon emissions.

resourceType.description: The type of the inventory. It is meaningful at the inventory layer and can be empty at other layers.

carbonEmission.description: The carbon emissions. To ensure accuracy, retain 24 decimal places. We recommend that you intercept the carbon emissions.

percent.description: Percentage of emissions. 98.76 indicates the proportion of 98.76%.

weightingCarbonEmissionData.description: Calculate carbon emissions by share ratio

ratio.description: Proportion of carbon emissions
Proportion of carbon emissions

subEmissionItems.description: Sub-level data, that is, site data under the organization

GetDataItemList.summary: This interface is used to obtain the details category of a data item.

period.description: Data filling method, 1: monthly value 2: annual value.

code.description: The identifier of the data item.

name.description: The name of the data item.

GetDataItemList.title: GetDataItemList
GetDataItemList.description: - obtain data item detail list under the current enterprise.

PushItemData.summary: This interface is used to push data items.

year.description: The year of the data created.

items.description: List of data to be pushed.

value.description: The value of the data item.

data.description: Whether the data is pushed successfully.

PushItemData.title: PushItemData
PushItemData.description:
- This interface is used for individual data item data.
- Data items can link data to services such as carbon footprints and carbon inventories.
- Depending on the platform configuration, active data on a yearly and monthly basis is supported.

data.description: The returned data. A value of true indicates that the request is successful. A value of false indicates that the request fails.

RecalculateCarbonEmission.title: RecalculateCarbonEmission
RecalculateCarbonEmission.description: - After uploading the data items, you need to call this interface to recalculate the carbon inventory data.

GetFootprintList.summary: Get the list of product carbon footprints.

currentPage.description: The pagination parameter. The number of the page that starts from 1.

pageSize.description: The number of entries returned on each page.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

pageSize.description: The number of entries returned on each page.

authStatus.description: Authentication status enumeration value, please refer to [link](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

isDemoModel.description: Indicates whether the demo model is a built-in model. A value of 1 indicates a true value and a value of 0 indicates a false value.

lifeCycle.description: The literal expression corresponding to lifeCycleType, `From Cradle to Gate` and `From Cradle to Grave`.

lifeCycleType.description: 1 is `From Cradle to Gate`, and 2 is `From Cradle to Grave`.

type.description: Product category enumeration value, please refer to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

unit.description: Unit enumeration value. Please refer to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

total.description: The total number of entries returned.

GetFootprintList.responseDemo:

GetFootprintList.title: GetFootprintList
GetFootprintList.description: With user-specified parameters such as enterprise code, current page, and page size, this API returns a list of matching product carbon footprints (or supply chain carbon footprints), including product names and product IDs. The product ID can be used as input parameters in other APIs to get the corresponding product's detailed information.

GenerateResult.summary: Generate a report of the specified carbon footprint.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

data.description: The returned data. `true` indicates that the request is successful, `false` indicates that the request fails.

GenerateResult.title: GenerateResult
GenerateResult.description: Given a product ID, this API initiates a task to calculate the carbon footprint result for the corresponding product. The task's status can be checked using the `IsCompleted` API. Following the generation of results, other result inquiry APIs can be accessed for display content.

IsCompleted.summary: Check if the result generation is complete.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

taskKey.description: The unique key of this generation task.

taskStatus.description: The status of the report generation task. The possible values are `running`, `success`, and `error`, which mean generating, generating succeeded, and generating failed, respectively. If you encounter a result generation failure, check the model, correct the model, and then generate the result again.

IsCompleted.title: IsCompleted
IsCompleted.description: This API checks the completion status of generating a report. It should be used before calling other result APIs, as they will only display content once the report generation is complete.

GetPcrInfo.summary: Obtains the oss address of the Product Carbon footprint Report.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

createTime.description: The timestamp when the report was created. The timestamp is in milliseconds.

GetPcrInfo.title: GetPcrInfo
GetPcrInfo.description: With the user-specified product ID, this interface retrieves detailed information and download links for previously generated PCR reports. To use it, two conditions must be met: 1) the result has already been generated; 2) the PCR report has been created.

GetGwpInventorySummary.summary: This API is used to obtain the total carbon footprint of a product and the top four types of carbon footprint contribution.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

resultGenerateTime.description: The time when the result was generated, in the millisecond timestamp format.

items.description: Top 4 types of carbon footprint contribution.

GetGwpInventorySummary.title: GetGwpInventorySummary
GetGwpInventorySummary.description: Returns the total carbon footprint data for the user-specified product ID, along with details on the top four contributors to the carbon footprint, helping to understand the overall carbon footprint and its main components.

GetGwpBenchmarkSummary.summary: This API is to obtain the total amount of active carbon reduction.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

percent.description: Percentage of emissions. The value is of the string type. Two decimal places are reserved for numbers. For example, "99.01" indicates the 99.01% of this type of emissions to the total emissions. Note that the returned string itself does not contain a percent sign.

quantity.description: Emission amount is presented with four decimal places. Normally, modeling doesn't result in negative values, but users can represent carbon reductions as negatives. The amount, paired with the unit, defines the emissions. Both are dynamically adjusted. If emissions exceed `1000 kgCO₂e/productUnit`, they convert to `tCO₂e/productUnit`. If they fall below `1 kgCO₂e/productUnit`, they convert to `gCO₂e/productUnit`. Otherwise, they stay in `kgCO₂e/productUnit`.

unit.description: Unit of emissions. The default value is `kgCO₂e/productUnit.` `productUnit` is the unit selected for the product. The unit value is changed to `tCO₂e/productUnit` or `gCO₂e/productUnit`. For more information, see the remarks in the quantity column.

quantity.description: Emission amount is presented with four decimal places. Normally, modeling doesn't result in negative values, but users can represent carbon reductions as negatives. The amount, paired with the unit, defines the emissions. Both are dynamically adjusted. If emissions exceed `1000 kgCO₂e/productUnit`, they convert to `tCO₂e/productUnit`. If they fall below `1 kgCO₂e/productUnit`, they convert to `gCO₂e/productUnit`. Otherwise, they stay in `kgCO₂e/productUnit`.

unit.description: Unit of emissions. The default value is `kgCO₂e/productUnit.` `productUnit` is the unit selected for the product. The unit value is changed to `tCO₂e/productUnit` or `gCO₂e/productUnit`. For more information, see the remarks in the quantity column.

GetGwpBenchmarkSummary.title: GetGwpBenchmarkSummary
GetGwpBenchmarkSummary.description: The API takes a product ID and returns data on the carbon emissions reduction along with a list of the top four contributors to carbon reduction. This info helps understand the total carbon reduction of the product and its main sources.

GetEpdSummary.summary: Obtain the total amount of emissions for various environmental impacts.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

carbonEmission.description: Emissions. The result is maintained up to 31 decimal places for precise intermediate calculation and subsequently truncated for display. It is advised to pair the emissions figure with the unit of the environmental impact result for a comprehensive understanding.

indicator.description: The evaluation index adopted for the environmental impact

key.description: The category key. The environmental impact category. Currently, a maximum of 19 categories are supported. Enumeration refers to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

num.description: Category num: the unique serial number of the environmental impact category. A maximum of 19 categories are supported. Enumeration refers to [Carbon Footprint Appendices](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/CarbonFootprintAppendices-en.pdf).

state.description: The data status. 1 indicates that the calculation is accurate, 2 indicates that the default data is used, and 3 indicates that the missing factor uses the value of 0.

GetEpdSummary.title: GetEpdSummary
GetEpdSummary.description: This API takes a product ID from the user and returns the summary of environmental impact generated for the product. This info helps understand the overall emissions for different environmental impact categories of the product.

GetInventoryList.summary: Get the list of emissions in descending order under the specified environmental impact (methodType), specified aggregate level (group), and specified calculation mode (emissionType).

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

methodType.description:
The type of the obtained environmental impact: gwp indicates the carbon footprint of climate change. 
<props="intl">[For more information, see the environment impact category enumeration.](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/energy-expert/developer-reference/enumerated-values-of-energy-expert#RhGn7)</props>

emissionType.description:
Type of emission

>  Valid values: footprint | emission. Meaning: footprint: all inventories are involved in the calculation; emission: only inventories with positive and zero emissions are involved in the calculation, and negative numbers are not involved in the calculation.

group.description:
Group by

>  Valid values: resource | process | resourceType | processType. Meaning: resource: aggregation by inventory group, process: aggregation by operation group, resourceType: aggregation by inventory type, processType: aggregation by phase group

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

unit.description: Emission Unit: The default value is kgCO₂ /productUnit. productUnit is the unit selected for the product. The unit value is changed to tCO₂ e/productUnit or gCO₂ e/productUnit based on the emission quantity. For more information, see the quantity column.

name.description:
Name 

> The name is related to the request parameters group. Request parameters: resource, return name parameter meaning: list name; request parameters: process, return name parameter meaning: process name; request parameters: resourceType, return name parameter meaning: inventory resource type name; request parameters: processType, return name parameter meaning: flow name.

carbonEmission.description: Emission quantity: may be positive, negative, or 0. To ensure the calculation accuracy, 24 decimal places are reserved for the calculation process. We recommend that you intercept data based on your business requirements.

processName.description: Process Name: It is only meaningful when the request parameters group is resource.

GetInventoryList.title: GetInventoryList
GetInventoryList.description: This interface retrieves a descending order list of emissions for a specified product ID, environmental impact method, group level, and calculation method. It's used to understand various environmental impact emission scenarios.

GetGwpBenchmarkList.summary: obtain the active carbon reduction ranking list.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

unit.description:
unit of emissions. The default value is `kgCO₂e/productUnit`. 
The `productUnit` is the unit selected for the product. The unit value is changed to `tCO₂e/productUnit` or `gCO₂e/productUnit`. For more information, see the remarks in the quantity column.

carbonEmission.description: Inventory emissions. Maintain four decimal places. Unit pertains to a higher-level unit.

benchmarkEmission.description: Benchmark emissions. Maintain four decimal places. Unit pertains to a higher-level unit.

activeReduction.description: `activeReduction=benchmarkEmission-carbonEmission` Generally, baseline emissions are greater than inventory emissions. Maintain four decimal places. Unit pertains to a higher-level unit.

GetGwpBenchmarkList.title: GetGwpBenchmarkList
GetGwpBenchmarkList.description: This interface returns a list of proactive carbon reduction information given product ID. It's used to understand the carbon reduction efforts at various levels of the product.

GetGwpInventoryConstitute.summary: Used to obtain the carbon emission composition analysis of a specified product. Carbon emission composition analysis includes two analysis dimensions: inventory and type. In the rendering effect, including a hierarchical list and pie chart.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

name.example: This is not used for displaying

carbonEmission.description: Emission quantity: may be positive, negative, or 0. To ensure the calculation accuracy, 24 decimal places are reserved for the calculation process. We recommend that you intercept data based on your business requirements.

byResourceType.description: Aggregated by resource type of an inventory.

items.description: Used for "by type" analysis in composition analysis. This is a nested structure, total carbon emissions-> sorted by inventory type, a total of two layers, the last level byResource is empty.
Organized by hierarchy from high to low, according to the flow-> process-> inventory hierarchy.

Used for "by inventory" analysis in composition analysis. Is a nested structure, according to the link-> operation-> list level, the last level items is empty
.

GetGwpInventoryConstitute.title: GetGwpInventoryConstitute
GetGwpInventoryConstitute.description: Used to obtain the carbon emission composition analysis of a specified product. Carbon emission composition analysis includes two analysis dimensions: inventory and type. In the rendering effect, including a hierarchical list and pie chart.

GetEpdInventoryConstitute.summary: Gets the result details of the environmental impact category.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

GetEpdInventoryConstitute.title: GetEpdInventoryConstitute
GetEpdInventoryConstitute.description: This API returns the emission amounts for various environmental impact categories at different levels for the given product ID. It helps understand the emission quantities for different environmental impact categories and inventories of the product.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

dataQualityEvaluationType.title: 数据质量评估类型。1是DQI，2是DQR。
dataQualityEvaluationType.description: The type of the data quality evaluation. 1 is DQI and 2 is DQR.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

reduction.title: 主动减碳建议
reduction.description: Proactive carbon reduction recommendations and advice.

reductionEvaluation.title: 主动减碳评估
reductionEvaluation.example: Trying Energy Expert for a more detailed assessment.

GetReductionProposal.title: GetReductionProposal
GetReductionProposal.description: This API returns carbon reduction proposals based on the product ID. It's useful for understanding optimization tips to reduce the carbon emissions associated with a product.

GetDataQualityAnalysis.summary: Obtain the data quality evaluation results DQR and DQI.

dataQualityEvaluationType.description: Data quality assessment type: 1 is DQI and 2 is DQR.

productType.description: Product type: 1 indicates that the carbon footprint of the product is requested, and 5 indicates that the carbon footprint of the supply chain is requested.

requestId.title: Id of the request
requestId.description: The ID of the request. The value is unique for each request. This facilitates subsequent troubleshooting.

score.description: Score. The distribution ranges from 1 to 5. A value closer to 1 indicates better data quality.

g1.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 1: activity data credibility.

g2.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 2: data factor reliability.

g3.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 3: time representativeness.

g4.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 4: geographic representativeness.

data_quality_score.description: The score. This parameter is applicable to DQR results. The distribution ranges from 1 to 5. A value closer to 1 indicates better data quality. The number of valid digits is kept to four decimal places.

g1.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 1: activity data credibility.

g2.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 2: data factor reliability.

g3.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 3: time representativeness.

g4.description: Data quality evaluation indicator 4: geographic representativeness.

items.description: Emission reduction measures for inventory item.

uncertainty.description: Uncertainty value. The model's overall percentage uncertainty results. "10.00%" symbolizes a 10.00% uncertainty, indicating that the carbon footprint lies within ±10.00%. This is derived from a weighted aggregation of individual inventory uncertainties.

inventory.description: The name of the inventory. Format: process name / inventory name.

uncertaintyContribution.description: Inventory uncertainty absolute contribution size. The impact of the quality of each inventory data on the carbon footprint results in the modeling process, when the uncertain contribution of a list is large, please improve its data quality as much as possible to improve the accuracy of carbon footprint analysis. The meaning of "1.4964" is not determined to contribute 1.4964 kgCO₂ e/unit, where unit is the unit of the product.

GetDataQualityAnalysis.title: GetDataQualityAnalysis
GetDataQualityAnalysis.description: This API returns the data quality evaluation results based on the user-provided product ID. It's useful for understanding the data quality of the carbon emission factors for each inventory of the product.

GetEmissionSummary.summary: Get a summary of carbon emissions.

ratio.description: Year-on-year.

weightingCarbonEmissionData.description: Calculate carbon emissions by share ratio

lastPeriodWeightingCarbonEmissionData.description: Calculation of carbon emissions based on shareholding ratio in the last cycle.

weightingRatio.description: Year-on-year of weighting ratio carbon emissions.

isWeighting.description: Whether to show the weighting ratio carbon emission.

GetEmissionSummary.title: GetEmissionSummary

schema.description: The request parameters for the operation.

GetElecConstitute.summary: This interface is used to obtain power composition analysis data.

water.description: Hydropower consumption and carbon emission data of each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

light.description: Photoelectric power consumption and carbon emission data of each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

urban.description: Data on mains power electricity consumption and carbon emission of each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

wind.description: Wind power consumption and carbon emission data of each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

nuclear.description: Data on nuclear power consumption and carbon emissions at each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

renewing.description: Data on renewable electricity consumption and carbon emissions at each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

zero.description: Data of zero electricity consumption and carbon emission of each enterprise.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e., 50%)

GetElecConstitute.title: GetElecConstitute

GetElecTrend.summary: This interface is used to obtain power trend analysis data.

water.description: Monthly data on electricity consumption and carbon emissions for hydropower.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e. 50%).

light.description: Photoelectricity monthly electricity consumption and carbon emissions and other data.

ratio.description: Proportion of electricity consumption to all electricity consumption in the month: example value: 0.5 (i. e. 50%).

urban.description: Data such as monthly electricity consumption and carbon emissions from the mains.

PushDeviceData.summary: This interface is used to push device measuring point data, such as power meter voltage and other data.

deviceType.description: The type of the device. [View device type definitions](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/Deviceappendixes-en.pdf)

devices.description: List of devices to which data is pushed.

deviceId.description: If the deviceType parameter is set to 12, 13, or 17, you must set the system_id parameter. The field name is still device_id. If the deviceType parameter is set to 15 or 16, no Other situations will be transmitted.

recordTime.description: Data generation time of measuring point.

data.description:
Measuring point information To avoid accuracy problems, the measurement point data is uniformly transmitted to the string. The function of missing required fields cannot be used normally. Some functions may be affected due to the lack of recommend fields. For details, please refer to the notes of equipment measuring points in the appendix. [Reference Point Definition](https://carbon-doc.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/Deviceappendixes-en.pdf
)
Whether the data is pushed successfully. Success is returned.

PushDeviceData.title: PushDeviceData

GetOrgAndFactory.summary: Queries the organizations and sites that are activated by using an Alibaba Cloud account. You cannot call this operation to query the organizations or sites that have not been activated in the console.

code.description: The code returned for the request.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

401.errorMessage: No permissions to call API operations.

GetOrgAndFactory.title: GetOrgAndFactory
GetOrgAndFactory.description:
*   If an activated site exists, the information about the site and the organization to which the site belongs is returned. If no activated site exists, null is returned.
- By current, endpoint only supports Hangzhou: `energyexpertexternal.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com`.
- To use this API, you need to be added to the whitelist. Please contact us through  <props="china">[official website](https://energy.aliyun.com/ifa/web/defaultLoginPage?adapter=aliyun#/consult?source=%E8%83%BD%E8%80%97%E5%AE%9D%E7%99%BB%E5%BD%95%E9%A1%B5%EF%BC%88WEB%EF%BC%89)</props> 
<props="intl">[official website](https://energy.alibabacloud.com/common?adapter=aliyun&lang=en-US#/home/en)</props> to apply for whitelist activation.
GetOrgAndFactory.requestParamsDescription: You can call this operation to query the information about organizations and sites that are activated by using the current Alibaba Cloud account without the need to specify request parameters.
GetOrgAndFactory.responseParamsDescription:
*   The information about organizations is returned.
*   The IDs and names of sites are returned.

GetDeviceList.summary: Queries the devices of a site that is activated by using an Alibaba Cloud account.

parentDevice.description: The ID of the parent device.

constKva.description:
The rated capacity.
Unit is kVA.

code.description: The code returned for the request.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.
Indicates whether the request was successful.

401.errorMessage: No permissions to call API operations.

GetDeviceList.title: GetDeviceList
GetDeviceList.description:
*   You can query the information about data collection devices of a site based on the ID of the site. If the verification is passed, the information about the devices of the site is returned. If the verification fails, a null value is returned.
*   Virtual meters at the site are not returned.
- By current, endpoint only supports Hangzhou: `energyexpertexternal.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com`.
- To use this API, you need to be added to the whitelist. Please contact us through  <props="china">[official website](https://energy.aliyun.com/ifa/web/defaultLoginPage?adapter=aliyun#/consult?source=%E8%83%BD%E8%80%97%E5%AE%9D%E7%99%BB%E5%BD%95%E9%A1%B5%EF%BC%88WEB%EF%BC%89)</props> 
<props="intl">[official website](https://energy.alibabacloud.com/common?adapter=aliyun&lang=en-US#/home/en)</props> to apply for whitelist activation.

GetDeviceInfo.summary: Queries the information about a device at a site that is activated by using an Alibaba Cloud account.

schema.description: The time string in the YYYY-mm-dd format.

code.description: The code returned for the request. A value of Success indicates that the request was successful. Other values indicate that the request failed. You can troubleshoot the error by viewing the error message returned.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

statisticsDate.description: The date on which the statistics were collected.

unit.description: The unit of the parameter value.

type.description: The type of the measuring point.

value.description: The value of the measuring point.

401.errorMessage: No permissions to call API operations.

GetDeviceInfo.title: GetDeviceInfo
GetDeviceInfo.description:
*   You can call this operation to query the parameters of a data collection device based on the device ID. If the verification is passed, the device parameters are returned. If the verification fails, a null value is returned.
*   You can query the parameters of a single device by day. If data of the device does not exist, a null value is returned.
- By current, endpoint only supports Hangzhou: `energyexpertexternal.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com`.
- To use this API, you need to be added to the whitelist. Please contact us through  <props="china">[official website](https://energy.aliyun.com/ifa/web/defaultLoginPage?adapter=aliyun#/consult?source=%E8%83%BD%E8%80%97%E5%AE%9D%E7%99%BB%E5%BD%95%E9%A1%B5%EF%BC%88WEB%EF%BC%89)</props> 
<props="intl">[official website](https://energy.alibabacloud.com/common?adapter=aliyun&lang=en-US#/home/en)</props> to apply for whitelist activation.

schema.description:
Choose one of fileUrl or fileUrlObject:

- fileUrl: Use in the form of a document URL, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100MB)

- fileUrlObject: Use when calling the interface with local file upload, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100 MB)

> The relationship between file parsing methods and supported document types
> - Long Text RAG: Supports pdf, doc/docx, up to 1000 pages
> - Image Processing: Supports pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, bmp
> - Long Text Understanding: Supports pdf, doc/docx, xls/xlsx

A unique parsing template ID used to specify the key-value pairs to be extracted from the document. You need to log in to the template management page, configure the template, and then get the corresponding template ID.

Language, parameters that can be passed
- zh-CN: Chinese (default)
- en-US: English

AnalyzeVlRealtime.title: AnalyzeVlRealtime
AnalyzeVlRealtime.description: Users obtain real-time VL results by uploading a document URL.

schema.description:
Choose one between fileUrl and fileUrlObject:

- fileUrl: Use the document URL method for a single document (supports documents with up to 1000 pages and within 100MB).

- fileUrlObject: Use when calling the API via local file upload, for a single document (supports documents with up to 1000 pages and 
within 100MB).

> Relationship between file parsing methods and supported document types. 
>- Long Text RAG: Supports pdf, doc/docx, and up to 1000 pages
>- Image Processing: Supports pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, bmp
>- Long Text Understanding: Supports pdf, doc/docx, xls/xlsx
The filename must include the file type extension.

The unique extraction template ID is used to specify the key-value pairs to be extracted from the document. You need to log in to the template management page to configure the template and obtain the corresponding template ID.
Unique knowledge base folder ID, used for categorizing documents and controlling the scope of online Q&A queries. If empty, the document will be uploaded to the tenant's root directory.

The default extraction method is "doc", with the following optional values:

- vl: Image processing
- doc: Long text RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
- docUnderstanding: Long text comprehension
- recommender: Recommendation type

jobId.description: Job ID, specifying which document's parsing result to query. This is a return parameter from the 'Submit Document Parsing Job' interface.

GetDocumentAnalyzeResult.title: Get Document Parsing Result

prompt.description: The question queried by the user

folderId.description: Folder ID, used to specify the range of documents for the query. If it is empty, it indicates that all documents under the tenant will be queried.

sessionId.description: Q&A session ID, used to record multiple Q&A interactions of the same user. If it is empty, it indicates that sessions are not distinguished.

answer.example: Carbon emissions in 2023 totaled 4.681 million tons

document.description: Documents associated with the answer returned by the query

SubmitDocExtractionTask.summary:
Extracts key information from documents using user-defined Key-Value or prompt templates. A taskId is returned upon successful execution for retrieving extraction results via GetDocExtractionResult.
Supports:
URL Upload: SubmitDocExtractionTask
Local File Upload: SubmitDocExtractionTask

systemTags.notSupportAutoTestReason: 避免任务过多影响性能

schema.description:
Choose one of fileUrl or fileUrlObject:

- fileUrl: Use by providing the document URL, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages, 100MB in size)

- fileUrlObject: Use when calling the interface with local file upload, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages, 100 MB in size)

> The relationship between file parsing methods and supported document types
> - Long text RAG: Supports pdf, doc/docx, up to 1000 pages
> - Image processing: Supports pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, bmp
> - Long text understanding: Supports pdf, doc/docx, xls/xlsx
schema.example:
fileUrl：https://example.com/example.pdf
fileUrlObject：FileInputStream generated from a local file

schema.description: The filename must include the file type extension.

A unique parsing template ID used to specify the key-value pairs to be extracted from the document. You need to log in to the template management page to configure the template and obtain the corresponding template ID.

- A unique knowledge base folder ID, used when you need to categorize documents and control the scope of documents for online Q&A queries.
- The folder ID needs to be obtained by logging into the intelligent document console.

Document parsing type:
Supports rag and long text understanding types, default is rag.

SubmitDocExtractionTask.title: Asynchronously Submit RAG and Long Text Understanding Information Extraction Tasks

GetDocExtractionResult.summary:
For Querying Information Extraction Result.
The input parameter taskId is obtained from the taskId returned by the interfaces SubmitDocExtractionTaskAdvance or SubmitDocExtractionTask.
The query results can reflect one of three statuses: processing, successfully completed, or failed.

taskId.description:
- Task ID.
- taskId is obtained from the SubmitDocExtractionTaskAdvance and SubmitDocExtractionTask interfaces.

GetDocExtractionResult.title: Retrieve RAG and Long Text Understanding Document Extraction Results

SubmitVLExtractionTask.summary:
Extracts key information from documents using KV templates or prompts with the Qwen-VL model, ideal for image extraction. 
Supports:
URL Upload: SubmitVLExtractionTask.
Local File Upload: SubmitVLExtractionTaskAdvance

systemTags.notSupportAutoTestReason: 避免任务过多影响性能

schema.description:
Choose one of fileUrl or fileUrlObject:

- fileUrl: Use by providing the document URL, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100MB in size)

- fileUrlObject: Use when calling the interface with local file upload, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100 MB in size)

> The relationship between file parsing methods and supported document types
> - Long Text RAG: Supports pdf, doc/docx, up to 1000 pages
> - Image Processing: Supports pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, bmp
> - Long Text Understanding: Supports pdf, doc/docx, xls/xlsx
The filename must include the file type suffix.

- Unique knowledge base folder ID, used when you need to categorize documents and control the scope of online Q&A queries.
- The folder ID needs to be obtained from the intelligent document console after logging in.

Unique parsing template ID, used to specify the key-value pairs to be extracted from the document. You need to configure the template on the template management page and then obtain the corresponding template ID.

SubmitVLExtractionTask.title: Asynchronously Submit VL Information Extraction Task

GetVLExtractionResult.summary:
For Querying Qwen-VL Model Information Extraction Results.
The input parameter taskId is obtained from the taskId returned by the interfaces SubmitVLExtractionTask or SubmitVLExtractionTaskAdvance.
The query results can be in one of three statuses: processing, successfully completed, or failed.

taskId.description:
- taskID.

- The taskId is obtained from the interfaces SubmitVLExtractionTaskAdvance and SubmitVLExtractionTask.

GetVLExtractionResult.title: Get VL Extraction Result

SubmitDocParsingTask.summary:
Parses text, tables, images, and more from documents. After execution, a taskId is returned for retrieving document parsing results via GetDocParsingResult.
Supports:
URL Upload: SubmitDocParsingTask
Local File Upload: SubmitDocParsingTaskAdvance

systemTags.notSupportAutoTestReason: 避免任务过多影响性能

schema.description:
Choose one of fileUrl or fileUrlObject:

- fileUrl: Use by providing the document URL, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100MB in size)

- fileUrlObject: Use when calling the interface with local file upload, for a single document (supports up to 1000 pages and 100 MB in size)

> The relationship between file parsing methods and supported document types
> - Long Text RAG: Supports pdf, doc/docx, supports up to 1000 pages
> - Image Processing: Supports pdf, jpg, jpeg, png, bmp
> - Long Text Understanding: Supports pdf, doc/docx, xls/xlsx
schema.example:
fileUrl：https://example.com/example.pdf
fileUrlObject：FileInputStream generated from a local file

schema.description: The filename must include the file type extension.

- Unique knowledge base folder ID, used when categorizing documents and controlling the scope of documents for online Q&A queries.
- The folder ID needs to be obtained from the Intelligent Document Console after logging in.
Whether to parse image content within the document.

SubmitDocParsingTask.title: Asynchronously Submit Document Parsing Task

GetDocParsingResult.summary:
For Querying Document Parsing Results.
The input parameter taskId is obtained from the taskId returned by the interfaces SubmitDocParsingTaskAdvance or SubmitDocParsingTask.
The query results can be one of three statuses: processing, successful, or failed.

taskId.description:
- Task ID.
- The taskId is obtained from the SubmitDocParsingTaskAdvance or SubmitDocParsingTask interfaces.

returnFormat.description:
- The document parsing result supports two formats: markdown and json.
- By default, the result is returned in markdown format.

content.description:
- The parsed content of the document.
- The format (markdown or json) is determined by the returnFormat parameter. For specific format details, refer to: [json return structure](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/energy-expert/developer-reference/interface-attached-information#b644b6255cojj)

GetDocParsingResult.title: Get Document Parsing Result
